newsitem.title: USA: Revco says committed to Big B merger offer.
newsitem.headline: Revco says committed to Big B merger offer.

text.p: Revco D.S. Inc said it remains committed to its offer to acquire Big B Inc for $15 a share, despite Big B's recommended rejection of the offer and adoption of a shareholder rights plan that would make the deal more difficult to complete.

"We remain committed to completing a combination of Revco and Big B," the company said in a statement. "We are confident the shareholders of Big B -- the owners of the company -- will recognize the superior value of our offer."
Revco said it will review the terms of Big B's rights plan and its board's recommendations to devise future actions.
Big B has approximately 22 million shares on a fully diluted basis, giving Big B a value of $330 million based on Revco's bid.
Revco said it currently owns 1,190 shares of Big B, representing 5.4 percent of Big B's shares on a fully diluted basis.
Big B said earlier today that Revco's bid is "inadequate from a financial point of view." Big B said it is reviewing its alternatives to boost shareholder value.
